abstract: Pres Obama says during forum on his administration's Precision Medicine Initiative that he believes any discoveries made using person's genetic information should belong to owner of DNA used; initiative seeks to collect genetic data from one million volunteers, and Obama says success relies in part on determining who owns data; many researchers backed by universities and medical center regard genetic material and test results as intellectual property they are not compelled to share.
lead_paragraph: President Obama said the success of his initiative to collect genetic data so scientists can develop drugs and personalized treatments hinged partly on “understanding who owns the data.”

headline.main: President Weighs In on Data From Genes
headline.print_headline: President Weighs In on Data From Genes

snippet: President Obama said the success of his initiative to collect genetic data so scientists can develop drugs and personalized treatments hinged partly on “understanding who owns the data.”
